intro: Cynoglossum schlagintweitii, commonly known as the Persian mouse-ear, is a perennial herb native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, succulent leaves and blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are often heart-shaped and have a distinctive, velvety texture. Cynoglossum schlagintweitii is valued in traditional medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
